reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed for 5 nights at the Soho Hotel in late March. I chose a Deluxe Junior Suite as I wanted a larger room. As this was not my first time at the Soho Hotel, I was quite familiar with the property. The location is hard to beat - right in the heart of the Soho area and within walking distance to a number of key Underground (Tube) stations - Leicester Square, Picadilly Circus and Tottenham Court Road. As you step out of the hotel, you are literally in the very centre of Soho, and yet within the confines of the hotel, you don't feel as though you are in a noisy crowded area.
reviews.title: Expensive but still generally of high standards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was immaculately maintained despite being over 5 years old by now, and there are nice small touches such as room scents provided nightly by the housekeeping staff. A very nice touch indeed.
reviews.title: Favourite place in London: Soho over Shoreditch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is nothing short of excellent. This is one of the best breakfasts I've had amongst the many hotels I've stayed in. A large array of traditional and modern English delights. I was also most pleasantly surprised that they took note of the fact that one of the days was my birthday and they gave me a lovely birthday cake! A very nice touch indeed.
reviews.title: Perfect pre-Christmas trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Staff are all generally very friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Truly a fantastic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The only real drawback is that the accomodation prices are relatively high and seem to keep increasing every year!
reviews.title: Room under expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was exciting and perfect (easy walking-distance to all the fun of soho, but set back from the craziness in a quieter area), the staff was terrific, the Old Fashioned at the bar knocked my socks off, and the room was great. Zero complaints - I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Great experience all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights from 11th April 2012 to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. I can honestly say this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in and we've stayed in a lot!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi on arrival the staff could not have been more helpful. For the entire stay they could not do enough for us even supplying a bottle of champagne free of charge for my husband's birthday.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd booked a deluxe room and it was everything we could have wished for and we had a private terrace with an excellent view of the London Eye.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: My only slight negative was the price of the pots of tea for two that we ordered from room service, over the two days it mounted up but other than that there is not another thing I can think of that was negative.
reviews.title: Favourite hotel in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Soho Hotel has everything you expect from a top notch five star hotel in London, the location is fantastic (in a quiet street but in the centre of the West End/Soho area), the rooms are spacious and very confortable, the breakfast very good, the amenities excellent and finally the staff are very professional and helpful. Nevertheless is a different hotel, and for someone who has the littlest interest on design, is clearly a must go Hotel. The lobby, the restaurant, the meeting rooms, the cinema rooms and obviously the rooms are, in terms of decoration and interior design, simply amazing, an authentic feast for you eyes.
reviews.title: An experience...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Service, standards, rooms, restaurant and bar. Everything was a delightful experience!!!
reviews.title: One word: Excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: So forget the movie stars in the lobby and the overly chic ambiance, this is just a really great hotel. The food is great (breakfast fantastic), location is perfect, rooms are spacious (and that means a lot in London) and the amenities are top shelf all the way. Front desk staff are professionals and the concierge fantastic. I've stayed at Covenant Garden and the One Aldwych - this is my preferred stay.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed in the Soho a couple of times. And it just gets better every time. Yes it's pricey but it delivers everything it promises. The rooms are luxurious but not opulent, modern but not cold. And all is very stylish. Breakfast is fantastic. And the staff are marvelous - the concierge team are the most helpful and clued-in that I've ever come across.
reviews.title: Near Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bar has lost a bit of its gloss and it is all starting to feel just a little dated but it's still fun and Soho is just a few steps away. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excelent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed for one night with friends as part of a civil partnership celebration. It was an amazing location with hospitality that was second to none.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (a deluxe double) was huge by London standards with excellent facilities.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bar is buzzing and the cocktails are pricey but excellent.
reviews.title: fabulous hotel

likes.liked: — sheer luxury...it felt like an oasis in the heart of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What sets the hotel apart though are the excellent staff. They are polite and cannot do enough for you, but also very friendly and laidback. This gives the hotel a very different more intimate atmosphere to others I've experienced and I would not hesitate to recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Soho hotel in London for 8 nights at the end of October 2008. We both loved this hotel. We stayed in a delux double which had a king size bed, sofa w/ottoman, side chair, desk and a huge bathroom with double sinks, bathroom was all in marble with toilet & bidet, huge tub & separate shower. The bed was very comfy & we're very picky about our beds, they aren't usually good away from home. Cleaning staff were great, turn down service at night which left a bottle of water for each of us, each night.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I have stayed at this property since a friend recommended it a year ago. This place is truly unique and magical. The staff is attentive to your needs and will bend over backwards to make sure each and every guest is happy - from your everyday schmoes (like me) to the uber-sexy-elite.
reviews.title: This place is Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can find decent weekend rates that cover just your room, but you should really go for the breakfast package, as the food is amazing as well!
reviews.title: good but not excellent...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: One last thing--the beds are the best in the world. I am an extremely light sleeper, but the Soho's beds are literally like sleeping on a cloud.
reviews.title: Just right location service and style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good location
reviews.title: London Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: clean and quality room, though a food-odeur/smell sometimes-ventilation problem?
reviews.title: Vibrant and fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed for a couple of nights on business and overall the experience was good. I had initially booked to stay for one night only but had to stay a second night. When I asked to extend the booking I was told the hotel was full but a room became available later on in the day, however I was told I had to change rooms. The second room I had was about half the size of the first. I went to reception and told them that I assumed that I was not being charged the same for the second night as for the first. They said I had been upgraded on the first night which I was not told on check in so am not sure that that was really the case.
reviews.title: Very expensive but very goof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bar was constantly busy and it was a great place for a little star spotting!
reviews.title: lots of positives and a few niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, again expensive.
reviews.title: Pleasing patchwork of English Modern style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resident's lounge is really lovely, beautifully furnished and decorated.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a charge to use the WiFi which at the rates being charged by the hotel is pretty outrageous considering it doesn't cost them anything to provide it once it is in the building.
reviews.title: Contemporary and Glam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful hotel in a fantastic position. Superb, friendly service without a trace of stuffiness or pretension in a very stylish and luxurious setting. Great cocktail bar - very lively on Saturday night. Bedroom exceptionally quiet and beautifully appointed. We loved it!
reviews.title: Style in Soho

likes.liked: — Effortless style in service and surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon on 7-9 Sept 2008. My husband had visited the hotel previously to ensure its perfection and received excellent hospitality from the staff. When we arrived, Mel on front desk had upgraded us to an apartment - what a surprise and so very generous. The apartment was amazing and so spacious. We love Soho and really, we wouldn't have left the hotel if we hadn't so much to see and do. The bar is a great place to hang out and it is very tastefully decorated. I can't thank Mel enough for looking after us so well. I truly had a wonderful honeymoon - once in a lifetime stay. Thank you.
reviews.title: loved the upgrade

likes.liked: — the staff. The decor. The location.
likes.disliked: — having to part from my gorgous apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Quietly exuding charm and luxury this hotel doesn't scream look at me from its small back street entrance, but as you catch sight of the huge statue of a cat as you walk down the steps to reception something tells you this is no wallflower of a hotel.
reviews.title: so-chic in soho

likes.liked: — that i didn't stop feeling spolit!
likes.disliked: — the price - this isn't an everyday hotel unless you are very lucky!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the the reception team, to the spacious boutique feeling rooms; the honesty bar in the communal living room to the quality foods at breakfast; everything this hotel does it oozes style and panache and if you fail to be impressed I implore anyone to not raise an 'all appreciating' eyebrow at the beautifully boxed complimentary chocolates left in your room or even the clever way in which the bathroom mirror never steams up. This is a hotel that has thought about the little touches that make staying away from home an absolute delight. I challenge anyone to stay here and still pine for home - i've been looking for an excuse to go back ever since i checked out!
reviews.title: Super Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Soho Hotel. From the minute we entered the Hotel the Staff were more than courtious and informative. As per previous reviews it is a very modern hotel, with lovely amenities. We stayed in a delux Junior Suite which was superb. Great big comfortable bed with lovely egyptian cotten bed linen. Great selection of TV chanels for viewing. The food was excellent and the waiting staff were so friendly and pleasant, always smiling. Overall the staff were noticably pleasant throughout our stay. I did have a massage and the only down side if I wanted to be picky was that I could hear the tread mill operating outside the door during my treatment, which left it a little hard to totally relax. Once outside the hotel there was a magificant buzz in the Soho area every night. The hotel is close to a lot of the Theatres most of which are in walking distance. Would definitately recommend the Soho ot anyone considering staying there. However, it is not cheap, but you do get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Loved the Soho

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our arrival at The Soho Hotel was a very rushed affair as we were late for our tea reservation due to hideous london traffic - but the hotel was great! They took our car and the bags we threw at them and sorted us out with immediate taxi so we could get on our way with minimal delay. When we finally checked in and went to our gorgeous room we found that only 1 lot of bags had made its way to our room (our car had 2 boot spaces) so we phoned down to concierge - within minutes the bags arrived at the door! Fabulous, late check out was no problem and probably the best shower i have ever had at a hotel! The hotel's restaurant was fab with great food and service. I would stay here again and again and again.......
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly lovely experience
reviews.title: A well deserved first place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Return visit to the Soho Hotel, absolutely fantastic, booked a Luxury Junior Suite and was delighted to be upgraded to a Deluxe Junior Suite, good start. The junior suite is very spacious with a superb king size bed, sofa table chairs working area, well presented bathrooms one common theme the rooms are immaculately clean!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We arrived early morning and dropped off our luggage before indulging in a little retail therapy with the promise that the front desk would contact us as and when the room was ready which they duly did. Returning early afternoon we were immediately taken up to our room, luggage already in place, other hotels please take note very annoying to check into room and then wait for the luggage to follow on!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we were visiting Xcel in Docklands for a concert we asked for some travel options and within 10 mins concierge had secured car and driver for a return journey. We enjoyed a couple of drinks in the bar before our car arrived and took us to our destination, at the end of the concert driver was there waiting to take us back.
reviews.title: Super Soho Hotel
